section.section: On or before the filing date, each domestic insurer shall prepare and submit to the Commissioner a report of its RBC levels as of the end of the immediately preceding calendar year.
The RBC report shall be in the form and shall contain the information required by the RBC instructions.

In addition to the requirements of paragraph (1) of this subsection, each domestic insurer shall file its RBC report:
with the NAIC in accordance with the RBC instructions; and
on written request, with the insurance commissioner of any state in which the insurer is authorized to do business, on or before the later of:
15 days after receipt of the written request to file its RBC report with that state; or
the filing date.

text.section:
If a domestic insurer files an RBC report that, in the judgment of the Commissioner is inaccurate, the Commissioner shall:
adjust the RBC report to correct the inaccuracy; and
notify the insurer of the adjustment, including a statement of the reason for the adjustment.
